Sentencas: This study aims to fabricate a porous anode coating for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) by the flame spraying.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: Flame spraying is an easy low-temperature process and offers the advantage of a reduced thermal stress.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: Due to the low-temperature, the initial selection of the feedstock will affect the deposition of the coating.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: In this study, two kinds of feedstocks were used.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: One was the commonly used NiO/8YSZ for anode fabrication.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: The second was the Ni metal with 8YSZ design for the low temperature flame spray.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: The special nickel-coated graphite (NiGr) was employed as the pore former.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: The results show that NiO/8YSZ forms a uniform and flat coating with small-sized pores.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: The Ni/8YSZ powder forms a rough coating containing large-scale pores.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: The addition of NiGr into the composite powder increases the porosity and permeability of the anode after graphite burn out and hydrogen reduction.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode

Sentencas: In summary, the use of a Ni/8YSZ/NiGr feedstock yields higher porosity (35-40%), gas permeability (1.37 Darcy), bonding strength (45.6 +/- 3.18 MPa) and better anode conductivity.
Titulo: Influence of feedstocks on processes and microstructure of flame-sprayed SOFC anode
